events.description: Release of Slovenia's trade data for December 2025, showing a significant narrowing of the trade deficit.
Annual summary of Slovenia's trade balance showing a reversal from deficit to surplus.

facts.fact_text: Slovenia's trade deficit narrowed to EUR 210.7 million in December 2025 from EUR 891.3 million in December 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Slovenia’s trade deficit narrowed sharply to EUR 210.7 million in December 2025 from EUR 891.3 million in the corresponding period of the previous year.

facts.fact_text: Exports increased by 13.3% year-on-year to EUR 5,363.4 million in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Exports climbed 13.3% year-on-year to EUR 5,363.4 million

facts.fact_text: Imports decreased by 0.9% to EUR 5,574 million in December.

evidences.evidence_text: imports fell by 0.9% to EUR 5,574 million

facts.fact_text: Slovenia recorded a trade surplus of EUR 1,488.4 million for the full year 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Considering the entire year, the country posted a surplus of EUR 1,488.4 million, reversing a trade deficit of EUR 7,701.7 million recorded in the same period last year.

evidence.evidence_text: Exports climbed 13.3% year-on-year to EUR 5,363.4 million, due to higher sales to both the EU (1.5%) and non-EU countries (23.7%).
imports fell by 0.9% to EUR 5,574 million, largely driven by a drop in purchases from non-EU countries (-3%)
the country posted a surplus of EUR 1,488.4 million, reversing a trade deficit of EUR 7,701.7 million
